name: Vite + React + Typescript Template
description: A modified version of the `react-ts` Vite template that contains various configurations that I use daily while developing React Applications. Designed for my own personal taste, but can be used as a base to begin building production-ready applications.

name: Planet Facts
description: Website that displays various facts about the planets in our solor system, built with Next JS and Typescript. Static pages are generated with 'getStaticProps' and a mobile friendly design is implemented.

name: Dictionary App
description: Single-page React application where users can search for words and recieve definitions, examples of definitions, and lists of synonyms and antonyms. Built using the Free Dictionary API

name: Password Generator
description: A web application that generates passwords with the ability to adjust attributes such as length, numbers, symbols, and capitalization. A password meter indicates strength and users can copy the generated password to their clipboard.

name: Multi-Step Form
description: A simple React component that built with the Redux and React-hook-form libraries to create a mult-step form where that allows users to switch between each step while retaining the state of the previous and next step.

name: Github User Search App
description: Using the GitHub API, users can search for the profiles of other GitHub users and see information such as their name, star count, and repository count. A light/dark theme is implemented.

name: Tic-Tac-Toe
description: A simple tic-tac-toe game with the ability to play against a "CPU" player. Users can keep track of their wins and losses and reset the game if needed.

name: Simple News Homepage
description: A news homepage page created with Next JS that was created to practice NextJS development and refresh my SCSS skills. Heavy focus on accessibility and responsive design.

name: BMI Calculator
description: A web page where users can get their BMI score and receive more information about the BMI Score. Built with React and tested with Cypress
